articles.title: WHAT'S GOING ON IN THE CLUB
articles.summary: This article details an astronomy club's upcoming events from August to October, including numerous star parties, lectures, and board meetings, while also announcing the club's rejoining of the A.A.N.C. It includes a comprehensive member questionnaire seeking feedback on club activities and preferences for various star party locations. Additionally, it features a correction to a previous article on celestial coordinates and a listing for a new astronomical supplies dealer.

articles.title: The Orbits of Visual Binary Stars . . contributed by Gerald W. Rattley
articles.summary: The article, contributed by Gerald W. Rattley, presents detailed information on the orbits of several visual binary (and one triple) star systems, referencing the 1970 Finsen and Worley catalogue. It provides orbital elements, physical characteristics, ephemerides, and observational guidance for specific systems like ζ Sgr, HN 126, β Del, and ε Equ. The analysis includes predictions for future stellar positions and notes their suitability for various astronomical instruments.

articles.title: TOTAL OCCULTATIONS
articles.summary: This document outlines a schedule and detailed observing notes for several total occultations predicted for September, with specific times in Pacific Daylight Time. It provides a table listing various stars, including double and spectroscopic binaries like β Cap and → Scorpii, along with notes on their disappearance and reappearance. Additionally, it offers information regarding the visibility of Jupiter's Red Spot during an upcoming star party and invites contact for further predictions.

articles.title: SAN JOSE AMATEUR ASTRONOMERS — AUGUST 1976
articles.summary: This document is a membership or contact list for the San Jose Amateur Astronomers, dated August 1976. It contains the names, addresses, cities, ZIP codes, and phone numbers of approximately 50 members, primarily from San Jose and the surrounding Bay Area. An additional contact, P. Berrier, and an abbreviation 'S.O.' are also included.

articles.title: SAN JOSE AMATEUR ASTRONOMERS, INC.
articles.summary: This document provides contact information for individuals associated with the San Jose Amateur Astronomers, Inc. It lists names, street addresses, cities, zip codes, and phone numbers for multiple people, along with the organization's main address in Sunnyvale, CA.
